name: Alex Turcu
headline: Student, Hacker, Engineer
bio:
I am a PhD student at Virginia Tech working with the System Software Research Group on Distributed Transactional Memory.

I currently live in Blacksburg, VA.  
My hometown is Bucharest, Romania.

I like Scala, Python, Linux, amateur radio, electronics and others too many to list.

tabs.Academic:
I obtained my combined Bachelors+Masters degree at the University of Sheffield, in UK.

My adviser at Virginia Tech is [prof. Binoy Ravindran](http://www.ece.vt.edu/faculty/ravindran.php). I recently passed my PhD proposal exam. You can find my thesis proposal on our [lab's website](http://www.ssrg.ece.vt.edu/), or directly [here](http://www.ssrg.ece.vt.edu/theses/PhdProposal_Turcu.pdf).

**Publications**:

* A. Turcu and B. Ravindran, [*On Open Nesting in Distributed Transactional Memory*](http://hyflow.org/hyflow/chrome/site/pub/systor12-tfaon.pdf), In SYSTOR '12, Haifa, Israel, June 2012. Best Student Paper Award

* A. Turcu, B. Ravindran and M. M. Saad, [*On Closed Nesting in Distributed Transactional Memory*](http://hyflow.org/hyflow/chrome/site/pub/transact12-ntfa.pdf), In TRANSACT '12, New Orleans, LA, USA, February 2012

**Technical reports**:

* A. Turcu and B. Ravindran, [*Hyflow2: A High Performance Distributed Transactional Memory Framework in Scala*](http://hyflow.org/hyflow/chrome/site/pub/hyflow2-tech.pdf), ECE Dept., Virginia Tech, April 2012

All my research work is open sourced and available [on BitBucket](https://bitbucket.org/talex/)
tabs.Personal:
**Ham Radio**

I am a licensed amateur radio operator. My callsign is KK4EDI. My equipment includes a Wouxun 2m handheld, two Software Defined Radios built from kits (a SoftRock and a Peaberry) and a 20W amplifier also built from a kit. I am planning to build a magnetic loop antenna soon.

**Open Source Projects**

I am planning to make this website software available [on GitHub](https://github.com/talex004/) soon. This is a static HTML5+jQuery alternative to About.me style pages. The page descriptions are read from JSON files, and may include Markdown formatted content. As you noticed, tabs can be used for organization.
